parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.05

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control - Map

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to [[posWorldToScreen]].

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> control : [[Control]] - map control

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position : [[Array]] - world position in format [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - screen coordinates in format [x, y]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_screenCoord = _control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] _worldCoord;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_screenCoord = _control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] [[position]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[ctrlMapScreenToWorld]], [[posWorldToScreen]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 16, 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command returns a 2D array with the position on the active map display. Say the return [0.5.0.5] would mean that your input 3d world position, like [500,1000], is currently at the center of the active map display.<br>
In other words you can make the actual world position (of an object for example), relative to your active map display.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
